TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit BamlLocalizableResourceKey extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents a key that is used to identify localizable resources in a .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This class represents a key that can uniquely identify a localizable value inside [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_baml](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-baml-md.md)]. It represents a combination of a , class name, and property name. The value must be added to the source [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xaml](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-xaml-md.md)] file either by using the `updateuid` [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_msbuild](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-msbuild-md.md)] target (for example, `msbuild /t:updateuid myproj.proj`), or manually in the markup. [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_baml](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-baml-md.md)] without a cannot be localized. The class name is the type name of the element that contains the localizable property. The property name refers to the property that has the localizable value. A special property called "`$Content`" is used to represent values that are the initialization text or content property of an element. For example the `$Content` property name would apply to the initialization text `Click` in the following XAML: `Click ` ## XAML Text Usage ## Examples The following example demonstrates how to use a BamlLocalizableResourceKey. [!code-cs[GrabBaml#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/GrabBaml/GrabBaml.cs#1)] [!code-vb[GrabBaml#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/grabbaml/grabbaml.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: public BamlLocalizableResourceKey (string uid, string className, string propertyName);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string uid, string className, string propertyName) cil managed

Docs.param: The Uid of an element that has a localizable resource.
The class name of a localizable resource in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_baml](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-baml-md.md)].
The property name of a localizable resource in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_baml](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-baml-md.md)].
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the supplied Uid, class name, and property name.
Gets the name of the assembly that defines the type of the localizable resource as declared by its <xref:System.Windows.Markup.Localizer.BamlLocalizableResourceKey.ClassName%2A>.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The assembly name is not required to uniquely identify a resource in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_baml](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-baml-md.md)] but is included here as a convenience.
